item.title: Report X-2025031064

  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO AND TRANSPORTED LEAKING PACKAGE TO DMP. BOX WAS FOUND IN A LOAD ON GREEN BELT OUTBOUNDS AT 3:50A.M. UPON OPENING AND INSPECTING PACKAGE IT WAS FOUND THAT 3 OF THE 6 CANS WERE LEAKING DUE TO LOOSE CAPS.

item.title: Report E-2025030184
item.description:
Report E-2025030184

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-12
  • City: MENOMONEE FALLS
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A Veolia employee was operating a forklift when the forks of the lift punctured a container containing hazardous waste, liquid (Mercury <260 PPM). Less than 8 ounces of waste spilled from the container. The spill was contained and cleaned up by trained hazmat employees. The punctured container was overpacked.

item.description:
Report X-2025030850

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-03
  • City: WAUKESHA
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 3rd a package as found during the PM sort that was leaking. The package contained UN1814, Potassium hydroxide solution, 8, III and was marked and labeled properly. The shipper was contacted to retrieve the package in order to properly prepare it for transport.

item.title: Report E-2025030246
item.description:
Report E-2025030246

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-19
  • City: TOMAH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 09:54 ET, XPO notified the Call Center of a cargo release at terminal XTM. It was reported that approximately 1 cup of Sherwin Williams Macropoxy 646 Part B released from four 5-gallon metal pales due to improper loading by previous terminal. The release impacted trailer #3159515. Call Center reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. CHEMTREC has been notified of the spill, report #2025021900056 was given by Monica.
